specialAbilities.name: Petrifying Gaze
specialAbilities.description: If a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the basilisk and the two of them can see each other, the basilisk can force the creature to make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw if the basilisk isn't incapacitated. On a failed save, the creature magically begins to turn to stone and is restrained. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is petrified until freed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.

specialAbilities.name: A creature that isn't surprised can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn
specialAbilities.description: If it does so, it can't see the basilisk until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again.

specialAbilities.name: If it looks at the basilisk in the meantime, it must immediately make the save
specialAbilities.description: If the basilisk sees its reflection within 30 feet of it in bright light, it mistakes itself for a rival and targets itself with its gaze.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.
